content.description:
Perfect arete climbing on amazing Joe's sandstone.  Start in the obvious pockets at the base of the arete and climb crimps, pockets, seams and the occasional  friction slap/squeeze to hold on till the top.  Top out is a bit cryptic; recommend taking a look at the top before blindly throwing for "jugs."

ADMIN edit: This problem tops out on the left side of the arete.  The direct finish is also V6.
content.protection: A few pads and an attentive spotter.
content.location: Take the climber's path (on the left) of the Hulk boulder uphill for about 20 yards; a small cliffband will come into view.  Go through the obvious break in the band (take care not to dislodge or trundle rocks).  Once on top, immediately go right.  The Boulder will come into view after about 50 yards.  Obvious arete.

content.description: Stand start on jug.  Right hand up to sidepull jug.  Chose from a sloper pinch and some crimps next.  Get your feet set and throw for a high left sloper hold that is not great.  Set your feet again and dyno for a jug hole.  Techy mantle high off the deck.
content.protection: As many pads as you can get up there
content.location: Start at Frosted Flakes and head up the hill past Dirty Harry and continue on the trail.  Stay left and continue heading up the hill as the trail branches.  You'll eventually see the giant platform built up under this beautiful problem.

content.description: Essentially the direct finish to The Shining.  Sit start in low pockets and climb crimps straight up the face to a scary, sandy topout.
content.protection: Pads and a good spot for the exit.
content.location: On the Shining Boulder a few hundred yards above The Hulk.

content.description: Sit-start on the flake and do a series of very powerful moves up to the underclings, then out to the thuggish gaston.  Fire up and around the lip to the jugs to top out.
content.location: The left edge of the Hulk boulder.

content.description:
Start on the two underclings in the crack and move out right through some burly moves and top out on the big finishing jug/crack.

Very powerful and thuggish.
content.location: Left edge of the Hulk boulder.

content.description:
A very fun V4 in its own right, it's also a good one to do a few laps on to warm up for The Hulk to the left.

Start on the flake/rail and then do a couple of big moves up to some great slots.  The topout is nice and exciting, but the holds are all there.

A sloping landing is the only detriment to this great problem.
content.location: The Hulk boulder, on the downhill face.

content.description: Sit start to the right of Pilot Light. Move to a really interesting pod and maneuver to gain two small crimp slots. Dyno to a good sloping edge in the crack. Top-out. You aren't supposed to use the holds out left on Pilot Light to cheat the dyno. Though I'm not sure why you would want to, the dyno is awesome.
Start on the juggy right-facing flake. Climb up using shallow pockets and slopey crimps. The top-out isn't as bad as you may think.
content.location: Up the hill from The Hulk.

content.description: Start the same as Dirty Harry. Do the first move to the jug and then traverse right on crimps and gastons to another jug. Ignore the bad landing and slap your way up slopey dishes and top out.
content.location: On Dirty Harry up the hill from The Hulk.

content.description: One of the best moderate problems at Joe's! Inexplicably not in the new, Caldiero Joe's Valley guide. Rated V5 in the Utah Bouldering guide. It may be a bit easier. Start matched on two pockets 5 feet up in the green streak. Climb straight up through edges, gastons and pockets to the lip. From one of two pockets near the lip, move up and right, reaching for holds over the lip with the right hand. The top out is not difficult if you find the holds. Tall.
content.protection: Two or three pads. The landing is good, though the problem is tall.
content.location: Antaeus is on the Stigma boulder. Hike uphill on the trail, left of the Hulk, past Dirty Harry until reaching the small cliff band. Go through this. To the right is the Sining boulder. Go up and left up the small trail for about a hundred yards to the Stigma boulder. Antaeus and All You Sinners are on the north side of this boulder. Antaeus starts matched on 2 pockets in the middle of the green streak a few feet right of the prominent dihedral.

content.description: An awesome, tall problem, for some reason not in the new guidebook. It is in the Utah Bouldering guide (Grijalva-Pegg-Bigwood). Start on the blocky hold, about 5 feet up, on the right side of the face move up and right through a jug, and get the right hand in the gaston flake. Make a long hard move (crux) up and left to a jug at the lip. Finish on good holds.
content.protection: Three pads and a spotter. The landing is pretty good, though slopes a bit downhill at the lower end of it.
content.location: Follow the directions as for Antaeus to the Stigma boulder (up the trail above and left of Dirty Harry). All You Sinners starts on the right side of the north face of the boulder on a good hold in the white rock about 5 feet up.
